response: "{ \"title\": \"Euler's Totient Function\", \"description\": \"Euler's totient function \u03c6(n) counts the positive integers up to n that are relatively prime to n. It is used in number theory and computer science.\\n\\n#### Problem Statement\\nWrite a function `eulers_totient` that calculates Euler's totient function for a given input integer `n`. The function should return an integer value representing the count of positive integers less than or equal to `n` that are relatively prime to `n`.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef eulers_totient(n: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): A non-negative integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns an integer value representing Euler's totient function for the input `n`.\", \"code\": \"from math import sqrt, ceil\\n\\ndef eulers_totient(n: int) -> int:\\n    result = 0\\n    for p in range(2, ceil(sqrt(n)) + 1):\\n        if n % p == 0:\\n            while n % (p * i) == 0:\\n                i += 1\\n            if i > 1:\\n                if p % 2 == 0:\\n                    result *= 2\\n                else:\\n                    result += 2\\n    if n > 1:\\n        if n % 2 == 0:\\n            result += 1\\n        else:\\n            result += 2\\n    return int(result)\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert eulers_totient(1) == 1\", \"assert eulers_totient(2) == 1\", \"assert eulers_totient(3) == 2\", \"assert eulers_totient(4) == 2\", \"assert eulers_totient(5) == 4\", \"assert eulers_totient(6) == 2\"] }"
